about_the_game:
In a far-future seascape cursed by the ancients, will you make mankind's last home a haven or a fortress?

Surge, Spire, and Sea is a 333,333-word interactive post-apocalyptic science fantasy novel by Nebula nominated game writer Stewart C Baker. It's entirely text-based, without graphics or sound effects, and fueled by the vast, unstoppable power of your imagination.

Back rebels or royals, or pursue your own rise to power. Speak for the spirits or fight for your own kind, or try to reconcile both by uncovering ancient injustices. Heal the creatures afflicted by a magical rot or defeat them in the name of defending the ones you love. Shape humanity's destiny with magic, alchemy, or high-tech masonry. 

But be warned: the gods, the spirits, and your king are watching your every move.

  • Master the art of spirit magic, the high-tech craft of masonry, or meld science and the supernatural with alchemical potions.

  • Play as male, female, or non-binary; cis- or trans-gender; gay, straight, bi, asexual, or poly.

  • Cast your lot with the king and his Spireguard or the anarchist rebels of the Surge.

  • Explore the Spires and Shallows, two distinct regions of Gigantea, humanity's last tower-home.

  • Seek out platonic, romantic, sexual, and polyromantic relationships with a diverse and memorable cast of NPCs.

  • Sail the rot-cursed Worldsea in search of life—or fortify your home with a powerful military fleet.

  • Experience a festival and night market with delicious food and entertaining mini-games, as well as gifts for your loved ones.

  • Immerse yourself in a post-apocalyptic setting where people of all body shapes, sizes, disabilities, skin tones, and identities are treated equally.

  • Strive to become the new ruler of your home or turn away from it all for a chance to explore the world.

  • Communicate in speech and sign language.

* Navigate a world propped up by centuries of truth, lies, and mythology.

* Climb ruined towers or seek refuge in a subterranean space of your own making.
